The original value did not change over the period, the book value change represented the depreciation of properties.\n\nProject Haining Wanpu was investment property that Haining Wanpu previously acquired from [previous owner]. The land was located in [location] ([size] sqm), the construction of Project Haining Wanpu was completed in [completion date] and was [leasing status] over the period. The land and buildings were depreciated using straight-line method with 50 years and 20 years of useful life, with residual value rates of 0% and 4%, respectively.\n\nAs at this report date, Project Haining Wanpu had not conducted final accounts. Though management stated that most primary contracts had been verified and accounted, the original costs may still not be finalised. Potential under-estimated construction payables and CAPEX commitments may still exist. You should confirm with management regarding any future CAPEX plans and factor capital commitments (if any) into your valuation model.\n\nTotal properties of Project Haining Wanpu were mortgaged as loan collateral in favour of [bank name].",
